title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:31 <tekzilla> hi, i used the "Large Wiki Export" extension (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export)  
00:31 <tekzilla> it worked fine and created folders for the spaces and XMLs in them for the docs  
00:31 <tekzilla> now how would i import that again ?  
00:33 <sdumitriu> Use the large xar import :)  
00:37 <tekzilla> ah thanks, so just create a zip with the folders ?  
01:44 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
04:01 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:04 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:23 <jbwiv\_> has joined #xwiki  
04:23 <jbwiv\_>  I see that the rss feed pulls all data from all blogs. Is there a way to only get rss data from one blog?  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:01 <cjd> has quit  
05:08 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <Spamchecker16> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <Spamchecker16> has left #xwiki  
09:16 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <sburjan`> has quit  
09:28 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne :)  
10:28 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol: I will be off tomorrow and monday, si if you think you'll release tomorrow or monday, please tell me what should I test for 5.0. The issues I reported, are they fixed ?  
11:12 <sburjan> also msmeria will be off from tomorrow to Tuesday, just like me  
11:12 <tmortagne> no they are not fixed: XWIKI-9096 XWIKI-9098  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> can someone "promote" xwiki-livetable-excel-export-macro 1.8 on Nexus, please?  
11:55 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: doing it  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: thx  
11:56 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: done  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> thx again ;)  
12:51 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <npm> has quit  
13:02 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
13:03 <vmassol> can I close XEM-246 as a dup of XEM-211?  
13:24 <sburjan> vmassol: yes. The issues are about the top menu which appears when a user is on a subwiki (not template)  
13:38 <sburjan> vmassol: I'd close them the other way around because the issue I reported is more clearer :)  
13:39 <vmassol> yes but the other one is older but ok I'll see...  
13:39 <vmassol> :)  
13:41 <sburjan> yes, indeed, it breaks the rule of the first reported :)  
14:21 <evalica> has quit  
14:28 <sburjan> vmassol, tmortagne : any idea what tihs mean when running mvn xar:verify ?  
14:28 <sburjan> [INFO]   Verifying [Wiki Editor Tests/testHRButton.xml]... errors  
14:28 <sburjan> [INFO]   - Comment must be empty but was []testHRButton]  
14:29 <tmortagne> sburjan: the comment associated to the document version  
14:29 <vmassol> this means the <comment> tag must be empty  
14:29 <tmortagne> search <comment> tag  
14:29 <tmortagne> sburjan: you should use xar:format  
14:30 <sburjan> tmortagne: I did, but it seems that xar:format does not fix the issues  
14:30 <tmortagne> ok I tough it was  
14:30 <sburjan> so I'll have to do it manually, for 98 docs it seems. yey, the joy  
14:30 <tmortagne> you can improve xar:format ;)  
14:31 <tmortagne>         // Remove any content of the <comment> element  
14:31 <tmortagne>         element = (Element) domdoc.selectSingleNode("xwikidoc/comment");  
14:31 <tmortagne>         removeContent(element);  
14:31 <tmortagne> looks like ot does  
14:31 <tmortagne> it  
14:31 <tmortagne> maybe you are using an old version  
14:32 <sburjan> 4.4 ?  
14:32 <tmortagne> you should have this cleanup in 4.4  
14:32 <tmortagne> you are sure you used xar:format ?  
14:32 <sburjan> I am looking in the content of a document  
14:33 <sburjan> <contentUpdateDate>1366890815000</contentUpdateDate>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <version>1.1</version>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <title/>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <template/>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <validationScript/>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <comment/>  
14:33 <sburjan>   <minorEdit>false</minorEdit>  
14:33 <tmortagne> you don't have any <comment> tag set anywhere in that document ?  
14:33 <tmortagne> maybe it's another document  
14:34 <sburjan> no ,my mistake  
14:34 <sburjan> indeed, I have comment there  
14:34 <sburjan> <comment>testCreateAndEditBlogPost</comment>  
14:34 <tmortagne> you have 2 comment tags  
14:34 <tmortagne> ?  
14:35 <sburjan> no, I was looking in the wrong document  
14:35 <tmortagne> ok  
14:35 <sburjan> I only have one document tag  
14:35 <sburjan> but still puzled why mvn xar:format does not work  
14:35 <sburjan> ok, it worked now  
14:35 <sburjan> cd .. and cd back in worked  
14:56 <jbwiv\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <vmassol> msmeria, sburjan: IMO this one is a blocker: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9075#  
14:59 <vmassol> it looks like a regression  
14:59 <vmassol> I'll check it now  
15:18 <sburjan> vmassol: yes indeed  
15:19 <tmortagne> does anyone has any idea what http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6633 means ?  
15:20 <tmortagne> no idea what highlighting the issue is talking about and it's the first time I see anything about a "multi-source mode" in XWiki  
15:22 <vmassol> I know of an issue with suggest when no results are found but this is different, you should ask jerme  
15:22 <vmassol> \*jerome  
15:27 <tmortagne> I would have but he is not online  
15:27 <tmortagne> anyway if he is the only one to understand that issue it does not sound very well written...  
15:35 <vmassol> you could ask for explanation on the issue  
15:35 <vmassol> he'll get the email  
15:35 <vmassol> ok you've done that laready :)  
15:36 <vmassol> multi source I know what this is about  
15:36 <vmassol> search suggests takes several sources  
15:37 <vmassol> you can go to SearchSuggestConfig  
15:37 <vmassol> ah there's a highlight field in there  
15:37 <vmassol> in SearchConfigClass  
15:38 <vmassol> actually not this one  
15:38 <vmassol> SearchSuggestSourceClass  
15:38 <tmortagne> would still have ben nice to say something about search suggest in the issue...  
15:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
15:40 <vmassol> sdumitriu: unping :)  
15:42 <sdumitriu> Unpong  
15:42 <vmassol> testing something… trying to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9075  
15:43 <vmassol> I know why  
15:43 <vmassol> in DeleteVersionsAction  
15:43 <vmassol> it goes inside if (!tdoc.getRCSVersion().equals(archive.getLatestVersion())) {  
15:44 <vmassol> and executes this:  
15:44 <vmassol> context.getWiki().getStore().saveXWikiDoc(newdoc, context);  
15:44 <vmassol> this creates a new rev  
15:44 <vmassol> so we delete a rev but recreate a new one  
15:44 <vmassol> so it stays at 3.1  
15:44 <vmassol> this line is not enough to prevnet a new rev from being created:  
15:44 <vmassol>                     newdoc.setMetaDataDirty(false);  
15:44 <vmassol> I added this locally to test:  
15:44 <vmassol>                     newdoc.setContentDirty(false);  
15:45 <vmassol> but it doesn't seem to work  
15:45 <vmassol> need to debug more  
15:48 <vmassol> ok I know  
15:48 <vmassol> got to go, bb in 20mn and I'll fix it  
16:03 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:16 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <vmassol> the explanation for anyone interested: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9075?focusedCommentId=74901&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-74901  
16:42 <vmassol> hmm actually I forgot to check one thing  
16:43 <jbwiv\_\_> has quit  
16:43 <vmassol> I need to find out why isMetaData dirty is true on the XWikiAttachment  
16:43 <vmassol> debugging  
16:45 <vmassol> hmm that's the loaddocument  
16:46 <vmassol> ok that looks like a bug, I'm going to fix this  
16:47 <sburjan> has quit  
16:55 <Denis> has quit  
17:08 <msmeria> has quit  
17:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu, tmortagne: I wouldn't mind a quick review of the commit that's going to appear in a few seconds before merging in 5.0 final  
17:15 <vmassol> basically I'm setting setMetaDataDirty(false) in XWikiAttahcment.fromXML()  
17:16 <sdumitriu1> K, I'll look  
17:16 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/56fd7f347145acca80867c909e57a321c2425c92  
17:16 <vmassol> thanks  
17:17 <sdumitriu1> Looks good  
17:17 <vmassol> we do the same already in XWikiDocument BTW  
17:17 <vmassol> (fromXML in XWikiDocument)  
17:17 <vmassol> ok cool  
17:17 <sdumitriu1> (but too many unrelated changes in this commit...)  
17:18 <vmassol> yeah a little bit :)  
17:18 <vmassol> I agree  
17:18 <vmassol> actually I should push to the 4.5.4 too  
17:19 <sdumitriu1> Speaking of 4.5.4, we should release it  
17:19 <sdumitriu1> If there's no volunteer for it, I can do it sometime in the following days  
17:20 <polx> has quit  
17:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks OK to me too  
17:22 <vmassol> ok thanks tmortagne  
17:22 <vmassol> I feel safer now :)  
17:22 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #xwiki  
17:22 <kushalkhandelwal> has left #xwiki  
17:23 <vmassol> however as I said in my unit test  
17:23 <vmassol> I think we're doing it wrong to not create a new instance  
17:23 <vmassol> actually the fromXML methods shouldn't even be in the class itself  
17:23 <vmassol> it should be in a factory  
17:23 <vmassol> (if it's in the class it should be static but that's not very nice)  
17:23 <vmassol> so if some code reuses the same object it could cause some issue  
17:28 <vmassol> ok guys  
17:28 <vmassol> we're at 8 bugs closed today  
17:29 <vmassol> let's try to reach at least 10 and if possible 12-15 would be great  
17:29 <vmassol> tdelafosse: btw you should also participate :)  
17:30 <vmassol> all committers and contributors are more than welcome  
17:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you too, might be good that you start looking at the existing jira issues ;)  
17:31 <vmassol> just find one that is invalid, cannot reproduce or a duplicate of another one, not a bug, etc  
17:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you're still beating me by 9 overall but I'm catching up: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11196#Two-Dimensional-Filter-Statistics/13255 :)  
17:38 <vmassol> (you're beating me quite a lot on real bug fixes though)  
17:49 <tdelafosse> vmassol : Yes sure I would :) For example I think that we can close XWIKI-7551 : 'XSS that can lead to becoming an admin' as "Can't reproduce" (see my comment). Since I can't close it myself could you close it for me ?  
18:04 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
20:14 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
20:25 <tdelafosse> has quit  
20:44 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
22:05 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
22:08 <sburjan> vmassol: wow, a lot of BDF activity today  
22:08 <naddy> has joined #xwiki  
22:08 <vmassol> sburjan: too bad you didn't participate! :)  
22:09 <sburjan> I see guillaume was on a closing spree :))  
22:09 <naddy> I recently heard about gsoc  
22:09 <sdumitriu1> Hi naddy  
22:09 <vmassol> sburjan: yeah unfortunately he was a bit too eager  
22:09 <naddy> hello  
22:09 <naddy> So whats the scenario?  
22:10 <naddy> Am I too late?  
22:10 <sdumitriu1> Not yet, just a bit  
22:10 <naddy> o  
22:10 <naddy> k  
22:11 <naddy> that is some kind of moral support  
22:11 <sdumitriu1> You should take a quick look at http://www.booki.cc/gsocstudentguide/  
22:12 <sdumitriu1> Introduction and Applying are important now  
22:12 <sdumitriu1> sburjan: Did you get my question from yesterday?  
22:13 <sdumitriu1> sburjan: Are you sure "xwikiorg-manualtestcases" is the right name? Why "xwikiorg"?  
22:13 <sdumitriu1> How about application-testreporting-cases  
22:14 <vmassol> sdumitriu: interesting blog post: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/05/git-automatic-merges-with-server-side-hooks-for-the-win/  
22:14 <sdumitriu1> naddy: You have less than 24 hours to submit an application through http://www.google-melange.com/gsoc/  
22:15 <naddy> has quit  
22:16 <sdumitriu1> vmassol: Interesting, but since we're not hosting our own repos, we can't use it  
22:16 <sdumitriu1> I doubt GitHub allows us to deploy hooks  
22:17 <sdumitriu1> But we can use hooks on our own machines  
22:17 <sdumitriu1> Or set up a command repository on one of our servers that mirrors github and does things when new commits show up  
22:18 <vmassol> yeah at least we can have the local script  
22:18 <vmassol> but we need to not forget to update it when we create new branches....  
22:18 <vmassol> I'm still unsure how cool it is  
22:18 <vmassol> might be too magical  
22:19 <vmassol> since we don't have that many branches and it doesn't take that long to checkout and cherry pick  
22:23 <vmassol> nn  
22:23 <vmassol> has quit  
22:26 <sburjan> sdumitriu1: no, I didn't got your question from yesterday.  
22:49 <abusenius> has quit  
22:53 <sdumitriu1> sburjan: Well, what's the answer?  
22:55 <sburjan> sdumitriu: sorry, I was away. Yes application-testreporting-cases is a good name  
22:56 <sburjan> I just wanted to emphasize that the test cases are for the XWki product  
23:13 <sburjan> sdumitriu1:  ?  
23:13 <sdumitriu1> Yes, created  
23:14 <sdumitriu1> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-testreporting-cases  
23:14 <sburjan> thanks !
